Article Title: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens dies aged 73
Article Text:
Johan Neeskens. (Pic Credit - X)

Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens , considered one of the best midfielders of his generation, has died at the age of 73, the Royal Dutch Football Association ( KNVB ) confirmed on Monday.Neeskens fell ill while working with the KNVB's World Coaches project, for which he was an ambassador, in Algeria. The cause of death has not yet been revealed."The world not only says goodbye to a gifted sportsman but above all, to a compassionate, driven and wonderful person," the KNVB said.Neeskens was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals and in 2004 was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA . He won 49 caps for his country.A former box-to-box midfielder who was renowned for his stamina, grit and skill, Neeskens spent the majority of his playing career at Ajax Amsterdam , where he won the European Cup three seasons in a row between 1971-73, and at Barcelona , at both clubs alongside compatriot Johan Cruyff.After retirement he was an assistant coach for the Dutch national team at the 1998 World Cup as they finished fourth, and later worked under Frank Rijkaard at Barcelona.He also had a spell as head coach at South African club Mamelodi Sundowns, which was his final role in professional football and ended in 2012.
Article Summary: Former Netherlands midfielder Johan Neeskens has died at the age of 73. He was part of the Dutch sides that lost the 1974 and 1978 World Cup finals. In 2004 he was named one of the 125 Greatest Living Footballers by FIFA. The cause of death has not yet been revealed.

Article Title: Need those derbies & fan following, says Bhaichung Bhutia
Article Text:
(PTI Photo)

KOLKATA: Beginning its journey with eight teams 11 summers ago, Indian Super League (ISL) has gradually expanded to 13 teams over these seasons.After being left out of the country's new top-tier ahead of the erstwhile premier division I-League, Kolkata giants Mohun Bagan and East Bengal were included into ISL at the start of the 2019-20 season. Then, honouring the AFC-AIFF envisaged future roadmap for Indian football, I-League champions Punjab FC were promoted to ISL last season.Keeping up with the promise, Kolkata giants Mohammedan Sporting Club - as the current I-League winners - were also added to the lot before the start of the ongoing 2024-25 season. However, despite being the country's highest level of competitive football, ISL is yet to achieve the desired level of fan following among the supporters of the participating clubs.However, Bhaichung Bhutia , the former India captain and one of the few legends to play the game in the country, believes that Mohammedan SC 's presence will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies , which in turn will make Indian football more exciting for the fans. The Sikkimese Sniper – as Bhutia was famously known in his playing days, also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL."It's great for teams with a huge fan base such as Mohammedan SC to come into the ISL. I have always advocated for Mohun Bagan, East Bengal, and Mohammedan SC for coming into the ISL, because these are the teams that have huge passionate fans across India. To make the ISL competitive and interesting, you need those derbies and passionate fans to be there," Bhutia said in an exclusive interview shared with TOI.With talismanic India skipper and striker Sunil Chhetri hanging up his boots four months ago, Bhutia had a straightforward message for the youngsters who are shouldering the responsibilities of the Indian team under the stewardship of new head coach Manolo Marquez."You need to be consistent with the national team. You need to start delivering, and it's teamwork. Obviously, you will have great coaches, but as a player there should be consistency in performances, and you need to keep working hard," Bhutia added.Asked to pick his favourite teams for the season, Bhutia said, "It's difficult to predict the favourites for the title. Mohun Bagan (Super Giant) have put in a lot of budget to make a great team. Mumbai City FC, who didn't have a great Durand Cup, are a team that will always have a good side. FC Goa have been consistent throughout the years. I think these are the few teams that are going to be favourites for this season."Over the years, ISL has moved on from its novelty factor as global stars - well past their prime - have stopped coming to India to join a developing league for a season or two. But Bhutia personally still loves to go down the lane when asked about his memorable moments from the league."My best memory of the ISL will always be the first year, with some of the greatest footballers around the world coming and playing for us. In the first season, you had players like (Alessandro) Del Piero, Nicolas Anelka, Robert Pires, and a lot of big stars playing with our own local players!" he said before signing off.
Article Summary: Bhaichung Bhutia believes Mohammedan SC will add to the intensity of the Kolkata derbies. The Sikkimese Sniper also hopes that the huge fan-bases that come along with the teams like MSC will result in a wider popularity of ISL. The former India captain also has a straightforward message for the youngsters.

Article Title: Rajasthan women crash to 5-0 defeat
Article Text: JAIPUR: It was an embarrassing start for hosts Rajasthan as they were outplayed by Chhattisgarh 5-0 in a Group E match of the 29th Senior Women's National Football Championship for Rajmata Jijabai Trophy 2024-25 at the Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium here on Sunday. Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Hina Nirmalkar scored the other two goals for the winners.Rajasthan kept Chhattisgarh on the same score till the end of the first half, but Chhattisgarh came back stronger to score four goals in the second half.Nirmalkar scored two goals in the 49th and 55th minutes to increase the lead to 3-0. Futan scored two more goals in the 70th and then in the 81st minute to help Chhattisgarh seal a comprehensive victory.In the first match of the day, Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Courtesy Lalam Haokip, Punjab took the lead in the 14th minute itself. In the 53rd minute, Mitali Melwal opened the account for Uttarakhand and levelled the scoreline. Punjab was gifted a goal when Uttarakhand's Achala Puri scored an own goal in the 69th minute while Nisha struck in the 73rd minute.Earlier, deputy chief minister Diya Kumari , who was also the chief guest, inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium. "The stadium will be developed into a world-class facility. It features a FIFA-approved football field," she said.Youth affairs and sports secretary and Rajasthan State Sports Council chairman Neeraj K Pawan, Rajasthan Football Association secretary Dilip Singh Shekhawat, Rajasthan United Football Club president KK Tank and the association's Women's Wing chairperson Roshni Tank were also present on this occasion.
Article Summary: Priyanka Futan was the star performer for the winners with three goals. Punjab defeated Uttarakhand 3-1 to secure three points. Deputy chief minister Diya Kumari inaugurated the newly-constructed astro turf football ground at Vidhyadhar Nagar Stadium.

Article Title: Djokovic rolls Cobolli to make Shanghai Masters last 16
Article Text:
Novak Djokovic. (Pic Credit - X)

SHANGHAI: Novak Djokovic powered through to the last 16 of the Shanghai Masters on Tuesday, steamrolling Italian Flavio Cobolli 6-1, 6-2 in just over an hour.The four-time Shanghai champion completely dominated 30th-ranked Cobolli, breaking him in the second and sixth games of the first set."I can't complain about anything in the game, I was able to play aggressively," Djokovic said."I'm glad to be progressing through a tournament that has meant a lot to me in my career."Fans waved Serbian flags and screamed in delight when the former world number one wrote part of his name in Chinese characters on a camera lens at the end of the match.Djokovic will next play Russian Roman Safiullin , who upset American Frances Tiafoe in three tight sets."I'm glad to finally play a match after three days of rain, it's been a hassle for a lot of players," Djokovic said.- Sinner-Shelton rematch -The last 16 has almost fallen into place after days of schedule disruption due to rain.Ben Shelton dispatched Spain's Roberto Carballes Baena 6-3, 6-4 to set up a Shanghai rematch with world number one Jannik Sinner of Italy.The American knocked Sinner out of the tournament at the same stage last year."(I have) great memories from that match last year, I probably watched the tape of that a couple times so far this year, but, yeah, I'm really looking forward to it, that will be fun," Shelton said.Sinner's chief rival Carlos Alcaraz , who beat him in the China Open final last week, will face veteran Gael Monfils.The 38-year-old Frenchman defeated his younger and higher-ranked compatriot Ugo Humbert 7-6 (9/7), 2-6, 6-1.Stefanos Tsitsipas recovered from a lapse in concentration in the second set to beat France's Alexandre Muller 6-3, 7-5.The 26-year-old will meet world number five Daniil Medvedev in the next round."(Medvedev) likes courts like this. I feel like I'm getting better with time... What is missing is trying to get a good win under my belt," said the Greek, acknowledging his uneven recent form."In the past, I might have said some mean stuff about (Medvedev's) game, but... I think I was completely wrong in that. There's a lot of interesting things in his game that he brings that are very different from other players."World number 10 Grigor Dimitrov is through after beating Australia's Alexei Popyrin 7-6 (7/5), 6-2.The Bulgarian will play Czech teenager Jakub Mensik, who already ended one top 10 player's hopes when he sent Russia's Andrey Rublev home last week.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic beats Flavio Cobolli 6-1, 6-2 to reach last 16 of Shanghai Masters. Four-time Shanghai champion will next play Russian Roman Safiullin. Ben Shelton beats Roberto Carballes Baena to set up rematch with Italy's Jannik Sinner.

Article Title: Top five near-unbeatable records in tennis history - set by Djokovic, Nadal, Federer and more

Tennis, a sport steeped in history and tradition, has produced some of the most remarkable athletes and extraordinary feats. While numerous records have been set and broken over the years, a few stand out as nearly unbeatable due to the sheer dominance and consistency required to achieve them.Here are the top five near-unbeatable records in tennis history that might never be surpassed.Rafael Nadal's dominance on the clay courts of Roland Garros is a story of unrivaled excellence. Nadal has clinched the French Open title an astounding 14 times, making it the most titles ever won by a single player at one Grand Slam tournament. Known as the "King of Clay," Nadal's mastery of the surface is unmatched, as he has shown both skill and stamina year after year.Wimbledon, the oldest and most prestigious tennis tournament, has seen countless legends, but none quite like Martina Navratilova. Between 1978 and 1990, Navratilova secured nine singles titles at Wimbledon, the most by any player, male or female, in history. Her dominance on grass courts was unparalleled, and her ability to adapt and evolve her game over 12 years ensured her place as the queen of Wimbledon.In 1988, Steffi Graf accomplished a feat that no other player, male or female, has ever replicated: the Calendar Golden Slam. That year, she won all four Grand Slam titles (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, and US Open) and capped it off with a gold medal at the Seoul Olympics. This achievement, known as the "Calendar Golden Slam," remains a singular milestone in tennis history.Roger Federer's 237 consecutive weeks at world No. 1 is one of the most impressive records in tennis. From February 2004 to August 2008, Federer held onto the top spot for nearly five years, a period of unparalleled consistency and dominance. No other player, past or present, has managed to maintain such a stranglehold on the No. 1 ranking for such an extended time.Margaret Court’s record of 24 Grand Slam singles titles remains the highest tally in tennis history for 50 years, till Novak Djokovic matched it in 2023. Achieved between 1960 and 1973, Court dominated across all surfaces, winning multiple titles at each Grand Slam event. Her versatility and consistent excellence set a benchmark that has proven incredibly difficult for subsequent generations to match.Novak Djokovic’s achievement of winning 24 Grand Slam singles titles is a monumental feat in tennis history. Spanning from his first title at the Australian Open in 2008 to his most recent at the 2023 US Open, Djokovic has consistently dominated across all surfaces and venues. His record not only cements his status as one of the greatest players in tennis but also highlights his unmatched adaptability and resilience over nearly two decades.
Article Summary: Roger Federer's 237 consecutive weeks at world No. 1 is one of the most impressive records in tennis. Rafael Nadal has clinched the French Open title an astounding 14 times. Steffi Graf won all four Grand Slam titles in 1988. Margaret Court's 24 Grand Slam singles titles remains the highest tally in tennis history for 50 years.

Article Title: Tamil Nadu's new tennis teens
Article Text:
National Men's Champ Rethin And Women's Finalist

Maaya

Show Glimpses Of Potential

Maaya steadily climbs ladder

CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu has always been a powerhouse of Indian tennis , producing legendary players who have left a lasting impact. The father-son duo of Ramanathan and Ramesh Krishnan, along with the legendary Amritraj brothers led by Vijay, have produced some of India's greatest tennis moments.It's quite a legacy to live up to and now there are two more talented teenagers from the state who seem to have the promise to keep the flag flying.Rethin Pranav and Maaya Revathi have been the talk of the city tennis circuit over last week during the course of the Fenesta National Championships in New Delhi.While 17-year-old Rethin won the men's singles title, Maaya, all of 15, fell short in the title round after a brilliant run through the week.The National Championships title was not the only high for Rethin. The Chennai boy had a good start to the season, reaching the top-100 in the world junior rankings. He then went on to play in his maiden Grand Slam at the US Open juniors . Although he lost in the second qualifying round, it was a moment to cherish for him."This was a good season as I got to compete in the US Open. The level of play was good and I had to adapt physically and mentally. I trained under Somdev Devvarman for two weeks in India and had learnt a lot from him. He helped me improve my stroke play and footwork and I could feel the changes in my game style. He is a good mentor on and off the court," Rethin told TOI.Apart from competing in the US Open juniors, Rethin spent time in New York watching top players in action. "I got to watch the match between Taylor Fritz and Casper Ruud and it was an amazing experience. The speed of the match was very high and you do not get to see this everywhere. A few learnings were the body language that they maintained throughout the match and the way they both fought back after losing a point," Rethin said.With the new season is not far away, Rethin is slowly looking to transition to the senior level and compete in ITF tournaments .Like Rethin, Maaya had a memorable run this season as she competed in her first Grand Slam at the Australian Open juniors. She also went on to attain her career-best rank of 135 and was one of the two Indian players to receive Grand Slam Grants."Participating in the Grand Slam was different as the level of competition was high and I got to know the level of tennis. This taught me where I have to work on to get better. I got a lot of exposure by playing against different players across all conditions in the ITF junior competitions. I got to know a lot of people on the tennis circuit and learnt something from each one of them," Maaya said.Maaya, who looks up to Serena Williams , has been training under coach Manoj Kumar for the past four years in Coimbatore.
